subtitle: Make this beautiful cheesecake in advance and impress your guests.

method.text: Place the crushed biscuits in a bowl. Mix in the spice. Stir in the melted butter until well mixed. Press the crumb base into a base-lined 25 cm round loose-bottomed cake tin. Press into the base and sides.
Cook in the oven for 8-10 min. Place the cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl and beat until smooth. Stir in the cream and vanilla essence.
Remove cheesecake base from oven. Leave to cool on a wire rack. Reduce oven to 160°C.

Slowly add beaten eggs to the cream cheese mixture, beating constantly until all are incorporated. Measure a third of the cheesecake mixture into a bowl and reserve. Stir the melted chocolate and coffee essence into the remaining mixture and pour into the biscuit base.
Place in the oven for 50 min or until the cheesecake is almost set. Pour in the reserved mixture. Return to oven and cook for 20-25 min or until set.
Leave to cool completely on a wire rack before removing from tin. Chill until needed.
Decorate the cheesecake with kiwi and star fruit slices and sprigs of mint before serving in slices.

title: Chocolate and vanilla cheesecake
